proposals.job_title: Full-stack dev with attention to visual detail
proposals.description:
My client has a Ferry Booking system (via custom API - no documentatiion. I will act as middleman). We tried to implement the query & booking & payment system. While doing so, unfortunately the developer is no longer available to complete the work. So we need to re-implement the frontend again with the updates (without changing a dot (client is very strict on exact frontend)).
Current setup is pure HTML pages. You will need to work on HTML pages and JavaScript only... Like I said, client is very...
proposals.message:
Okay, here's my attempt:

Hey there,

"Need to re-implement the frontend again...client is very strict on exact frontend" - I definitely understand the need to respect an existing, visually-defined product! I once spent a week recreating a specific font rendering bug for a client because *removing* it was a deal-breaker for them.

For this ferry booking system, I'd start by thoroughly reverse-engineering the existing HTML and Javascript to fully understand the interactions. Then, working closely with you as the middleman, implement the necessary updates while *exactly* preserving the current look and feel. After that, rigorous testing across different browsers to ensure pixel-perfect parity.

If you think this sounds good, I'm happy to hop on a quick call to discuss the API and specific challenges in more detail.

proposals.job_title: Full Stack AI Automation and Web Scraping Engineer Needed
proposals.description: We are seeking a skilled Full Stack AI Automation and Web Scraping Engineer to enhance our data-driven projects. The ideal candidate will have experience in developing automated systems using AI technologies and extracting data from various web sources. You will work on building efficient pipelines for data collection and processing, as well as implementing machine learning models. A strong understanding of both front-end and back-end development is essential. If you are passionate about automat...
proposals.message:
Hey there,

Saw you're looking for someone to really streamline your data-driven projects with automation, specifically tackling web scraping and AI implementation. That resonates – I've spent the last 20 years neck-deep in this stuff.

I actually just wrapped up a project where the client was manually compiling market research data; it was taking them weeks. By building a custom scraping tool integrated with a basic NLP model, we cut that down to a few hours.

For you, I'd think we could start with a quick audit of your current data collection process, then build out a robust scraping pipeline, and finally look at integrating some AI tools to automate analysis and reporting.

If this approach sounds interesting, I'm happy to jump on a quick call to chat through the specifics. No pressure either way.

proposals.job_title: Offline AI Coding Assistant Development
proposals.description: We are seeking an experienced developer to create an offline AI coding assistant using Ollama-supported models that can run locally. The ideal candidate will be well-versed in AI model integration and possess the ability to tailor the assistant for coding tasks. Responsibilities include designing the system architecture, implementing the model, and ensuring optimal performance. If you have a passion for AI and coding, and are ready to tackle a challenging project, we want to hear from you! Write...
proposals.message:
Hey there,

Saw you're looking to build an offline AI coding assistant – "tackle a challenging project" indeed! I've been tinkering with local AI models for a while now. Actually, just last month I was trying to get a similar setup running on a Raspberry Pi for a personal project, and learned a few things the hard way about optimizing performance on limited resources.

Here's how I'd approach it for you: First, a deep dive into selecting the right Ollama model for your specific coding needs. Then, designing a lean system architecture that prioritizes speed and offline functionality. Finally, rigorous testing to ensure it's actually helpful and not just spitting out random code snippets.

Would love to chat more about your vision for the assistant and see if my experience aligns with what you're hoping to achieve. Let me know if you're free for a quick call.

proposals.job_title: MVP Development for Habit-Tracking App with Gamification Features
proposals.description:
I’m looking for a developer to help build an MVP for a mobile habit-forming app. The app should be clean, modern, and user-friendly—visually appealing but minimal, with no fluff. It will include preset daily and weekly challenges across different categories, with the ability for users to create their own custom challenges (if they subscribe to the top tier).

The app needs to include basic gamification features, including XP, streaks, and progress tracking. There will also be a lightweight socia...
proposals.message:
Hey there,

I saw you're looking for a dev to build an MVP for your habit-tracking app with gamification – especially with the preset challenges and custom challenges for the top tier. That detail about subscriptions unlocking the custom challenges? Smart move for monetization.

I remember years ago, automating a lead-gen system where that tiered access model was crucial. Initially, free users complained about limitations, but the conversion to paid once they experienced the basic value was significant. The key was making the free features *good* and the paid features *obviously better*.

For your app, I'd suggest focusing first on nailing the core habit tracking with basic gamification features. Once that’s solid, we could then concentrate on the subscription model and the custom challenges, integrating them smoothly without disrupting the user experience. Then, finally we'd look at the social integration.

I’d love to chat more about your vision for the app. Shoot me a message if you're interested!

proposals.job_title: Seeking U.S. Immigration Attorney for EB2-NIW Startup Case (Tech-based, with ProfVal support)
proposals.description:
My name is Phung Anh Vinh, a senior automation and IoT engineer based in Vietnam with over 30 years of experience. I am preparing to file an EB-2 NIW petition based on a startup business plan in the U.S. (Texas) focused on low-cost IoT and automation solutions for agriculture and environmental control.

I have completed:

A draft business plan (can be refined)

A technical resume (with detailed project history)

Summaries of 3 impactful IoT projects

Ongoing coordination with ProfVal for profess...
proposals.message:
Hi Phung Anh Vinh,

The need for *low-cost* IoT solutions for agriculture definitely resonated with me. I've seen first-hand how expensive some of these systems can be, putting them out of reach for many smaller farms and businesses.

A few years back, I worked on a project automating a small hydroponics operation, and the biggest hurdle was always finding affordable sensors and actuators.

Regarding your EB-2 NIW petition, I'd be happy to help in any way I can. Given your focus and ProfVal support, it feels like the first step would be to refine your business plan, maybe highlighting the innovative aspects that address the need for cost reduction specifically. Then, we could see how best to tie in your impactful projects as examples of your solution.

Would you be open to a quick chat to discuss how I can assist you?

proposals.job_title: GoHighLevel + Make.com Integration Specialist Needed
proposals.description:
We need a freelancer with experience in GoHighLevel and Make com to set up our complete landingpage system using the provided ZIP file.

This includes both:
1. Full technical setup
2. SEO optimized design of the landingpage

PACKAGE CONTENT:
- Backend security modules
- GDPR functions
- Cloudflare rate limiting worker
- Frontend fallback file
- Make com modules and JSON files
- PDF documentation
- Step-by-step instructions in FREELANCER_README md

YOUR TASKS:
- Set up everything inside GoHighLev...
proposals.message:
Hey there,

Saw you need help setting up your GoHighLevel landing page system from that ZIP file, especially with the security modules and GDPR functions. I totally get that – getting those initial security layers right is crucial, and it's way easier to bake them in from the start than try to add them later. I once spent a whole weekend tracking down a single compromised endpoint on a hastily built system; learned my lesson the hard way!

For your project, I'd first focus on getting GoHighLevel configured with the backend modules and Cloudflare integration. Then, I'd tackle the landing page setup itself, making sure the design incorporates the SEO best practices and GDPR elements from the documentation. Finally, we can tie everything together using the Make.com modules you've provided.

If you're free for a quick chat, I'd love to understand your long-term vision for this system a bit better. No pressure either way!

proposals.job_title: Developer with API Experience
proposals.description:
Working on an automation project that will involve creating automations into several critical ads API's, such as Google, Microsoft, Meta and more.

This will include a variety of tasks, including taking raw data from a Google Sheet and Drive and pushing through to platforms, but could also include other items as well.

The big "push" for the project will be the entire month of April but this is almost certainly going to be a 6 month project.
proposals.message:
Hey there,

Saw your project description focusing on "taking raw data from a Google Sheet and Drive and pushing through to platforms" – that sounds like exactly the kind of challenge I enjoy. I once spent a week wrestling with a similar data-wrangling situation, only to find a single misplaced comma was the culprit. Fun times!

For your project, I'd suggest starting with a deep dive into those API docs to understand their quirks, then building out some modular scripts to handle the data transformation and pushing. Finally, we'd implement error handling and monitoring to ensure everything runs smoothly, especially during your busy month of April.

With your 6-month timeframe, this feels like a great opportunity to build something robust and sustainable. Would love to chat more about your specific needs and how I can help. Let me know if you're free for a quick call sometime.

proposals.job_title: DBT with Databricks
proposals.description:
Hi All,
I'm seeking someone with hands-on experience using dbt with Databricks to help me set up and test a simple ETL pipeline.

I'll provide either:
A Databricks personal access token (PAT) or credentials for a workspace

The goal is to:
- Connect dbt to Databricks
- Consume data in both tabular (CSV/Delta) and JSON format
- Build a dbt pipeline that:
- Loads data into the Bronze layer
- Cleans/transforms it into a Silver layer
- Aggregates results into a Gold layer

This will help me understa...
proposals.message:
Hi there,

"Seeking someone with hands-on experience... to help me set up and test a simple ETL pipeline" - I totally get that. I spent a frustrating week last year trying to wrangle JSON data into a Delta table, only to realize a simple configuration tweak in dbt could have saved me a mountain of manual data wrangling.

For your project, I'd suggest tackling it in stages: first, confirming the dbt connection and data source access using your provided credentials. Then, we'd focus on getting data flowing smoothly into that Bronze layer, making sure CSV/Delta and JSON are both handled properly. Finally, crafting those Silver/Gold transformations to get the aggregated results you need.

Happy to chat more about your specific needs and see if my approach aligns with your vision. Let me know if you're free for a quick call sometime this week.

proposals.job_title: Need Android App Developer - Experience in publishing app
proposals.description:
I require an experienced Android developer to publish a native Android application. Developers should have strong experience building REST API apps from scratch and publishing them on Google Play Store. Experience with REST APIs, publishing apps on Google Play Store is essential.
Work Details :-
1.Change launcher Icon and some images in the existing app
2.You have to publish the app (2) on playstore old playconsole account , I dont have one , need smooth release
proposals.message:
Hey there,

Saw you're looking for someone to handle the Android app publishing, especially getting those two apps live on your old Play Console account. I get it – the app store release process can be a real headache, especially with all the changes Google makes!

I remember once spending an entire afternoon wrestling with a particularly stubborn image asset that wouldn't resize properly for the Play Store requirements. Little things can really eat up your time.

For your project, I'd suggest first getting the icon and image changes finalized. Next, we'd tackle prepping the apps for release. Finally, I'd handle the publishing to your Play Console, making sure everything goes smoothly.

If you're interested, I'd be happy to chat more about your timeline and specific needs for those image updates. No pressure, just happy to help if I can.

proposals.job_title: Experienced Flutter Developer Needed to Enhance Funky Live App with Mini-Games
proposals.description:
We're looking for a talented Flutter developer to work on our existing mobile application, Funky Live. We need a developer who can modify existing features, enhance the UI/UX, and integrate new interactive components such as mini-games and animated gift-sharing features (similar to SVGA animations in Fancy Live).

Responsibilities:

Modify and enhance existing features of the Funky Live app

Integrate mini-games into the app to boost user engagement

Implement fancy gift-sharing animations (SVGA...
proposals.message:
"Integrating mini-games and SVGA animations, especially into an existing app, can definitely be tricky," I read that and immediately thought about a project I did last year where we had to shoehorn some Unity-based AR features into an otherwise native iOS app. The integration itself was surprisingly smooth, but the *communication* between the new and old codebases? A nightmare!

Here's how I'd tackle this for Funky Live: first, I'd do a deep dive into your current code structure to understand the best way to "plug in" these new features without causing performance issues. Then, we can prototype one mini-game and the animation integration to make sure they feel seamless within the Funky Live experience. Finally, we’d iterate based on your feedback.

Would love to chat more about the specifics of your codebase and the kind of mini-games you're envisioning. Let me know if you're free for a quick call!

proposals.job_title: Web Development for AI Real Estate Site
proposals.description: We are looking for a skilled web developer to create a clean, 4-page website tailored for AI agents . The site must support embeds such as Relevance and vapi, ensuring seamless integration with our tools. It should be mobile-friendly and designed for easy updates, allowing us to manage content without technical assistance. If you have experience in developing user-friendly websites that meet these criteria, we would love to hear from you!
proposals.message:
Okay, here's my attempt at an Upwork proposal, channeling my inner Timothy Poulton:

"Hey there,

Reading your description, the bit about wanting a site you can easily update yourselves really resonated. I get it – being stuck relying on a developer for every little tweak can be a real pain. I once spent three days trying to explain the difference between serif and sans-serif fonts to a client who just wanted his logo a *little* bigger. Never again, for either of us!

For your AI agent site, I'd suggest starting with a simple content management system (CMS) setup, focusing on intuitive design. Then, we'll ensure seamless integration of Relevance and vapi. Finally, I’ll create training videos showing you the ropes for easy content edits.

Interested in chatting through your specific needs a bit more? I'm happy to jump on a quick call whenever you have a moment."

proposals.job_title: Shopify Store Setup Needed with Custom Theme Integration
proposals.description: We are looking for an experienced Shopify developer to build a comprehensive store using a purchased theme. The project includes creating all necessary product pages and legal documentation, as well as setting up the payment processor for seamless transactions. The ideal candidate should have a strong background in eCommerce and be able to deliver a polished, user-friendly store that aligns with the theme's design. Please provide examples of previous Shopify projects you've completed to showcase...
proposals.message:
"Saw you're looking for someone to build a comprehensive Shopify store from a purchased theme, and that includes handling all the product pages and legal stuff. That's often where things bog down, right?

I remember setting up a similar store for a client selling handmade jewelry a few years back. We got so caught up in the product photography, we almost forgot the legal pages, and *that* nearly held up the launch.

For your project, I'd start by getting the core theme integrated and looking sharp. Then, we can tackle the product pages in batches to ensure consistency. Finally, I'd dedicate time to crafting those essential legal docs and properly integrating the payment gateway.

I'd be happy to chat more about your specific needs and how my experience can help bring your vision to life. Let me know if you're free for a quick call sometime this week."

proposals.job_title: Xano + Webflow Integration Expert - for Top 1% 💎 Upwork Partner
proposals.description:
With over $2,100,000 spent on Upwork over 12 years and a 4.8-star rating, FCF is a 28-year young strategic flight information products company.

Project Overview:

We're relatively new to Webflow and have been trying to integrate our content from Airtable. We thought Whalesync would be the perfect solution, but it turned out that our data structure, with many junction tables, was too complex. The result? Data that wouldn't sync properly and UI components that displayed incorrectly. We need a bet...
proposals.message:
Hey FCF team,

"Data that wouldn't sync properly and UI components that displayed incorrectly" – I felt that! Been there, wrestled with that. I once spent a week trying to wrangle data with Zapier, only to realize a custom API connection was the only way to truly tame it.

Seeing as Whalesync wasn’t a perfect fit for your complex data, I'd suggest we first dive deep into your Xano setup and Webflow structure. Then, we could explore building custom Xano API endpoints specifically for your Webflow components. Finally, thorough testing to ensure a seamless experience.

Would be happy to chat through the specifics and see if my experience could be helpful here.

proposals.job_title: Cold Outreach Campaign Setup & Management - Email Marketing Expert
proposals.description:
We are looking for an experienced Cold Email Outreach Specialist to help us identify, contact, and qualify leads through personalized email campaigns. You will be responsible for managing outreach tools, crafting engaging email sequences, and optimizing for conversions.

Responsibilities:
Research and build targeted lead lists based on our ideal customer profile (ICP)

Write and personalize cold email sequences (including follow-ups)

Use tools like Instantly.ai, Mailshake, Lemlist, or similar f...
proposals.message:
"Saw you're looking for someone to wrangle those cold email campaigns and ditch the manual grind. I get it – I remember spending a week building a single lead list by hand once, never again!

My approach would be to first really nail down that ICP with you – a solid profile means better targeting and less wasted effort. Then, craft a sequence that feels genuinely personal, not just another generic email blast. Finally, A/B test everything to see what resonates and keep tweaking for better results.

Happy to chat more about your specific needs and how I can help free you from those spreadsheets. Are you available for a quick call this week?"

proposals.job_title: Infrastructure for Web Scraping and LLM
proposals.description:
I need someone to set up the following, end to end. Note, GPT generated this as I am not an architect. We can discuss tools etc. 

Alright, let’s break it down into steps and tools:

Step 1: Setting Up the Web Scraper Agent
	•	Tool: Use a web scraping framework like Scrapy or a no-code solution like Octoparse if you prefer a visual interface.
	•	Task: Configure the scraper to crawl predefined domains that list toddler-friendly activities. Extract the relevant URLs and metadata (e.g., event name,...
proposals.message:
Hey there,

I read your description about needing an end-to-end setup for web scraping and LLM integration, and the "manual processes" pain point definitely resonates. I remember automating a similar data extraction pipeline for a local historical society a few years back – what started as a simple scraping job quickly turned into a tangled web of configurations and data cleaning. Learned a lot!

For your project, I'm thinking we could start with a focused pilot: 1) nail down your target websites and preferred scraping tool (Scrapy or Octoparse – happy to discuss pros and cons), 2) then build a modular data pipeline to prep the extracted info for your LLM, and 3) finally, integrate everything with clear monitoring so you can tweak it as needed.

Would love to chat more about the specific challenges you're anticipating. Let me know if you're free for a quick call sometime this week.

proposals.job_title: Digital Display of Buffet Information
proposals.description:
We are looking for an experienced developer or agency to implement a digital solution for displaying food information at our buffets.

Initial Situation
We currently label our buffets with paper signs. Information about food, allergens, etc. comes from the catering management software Sanalogic or is manually maintained in Word or Excel.

Project Goal
We want to switch to digital screens that display the information automatically and in a visually appealing way. The content should be imported di...
proposals.message:
Hi there,

"Switching to digital screens that display the information automatically..." That really resonated with me! I've seen firsthand how much time restaurants waste on manual updates. A while back, I helped a local cafe automate their daily specials board using a simple script and a Raspberry Pi; it was a game changer for them.

For your buffet, I'd suggest a phased approach: first, focus on connecting Sanalogic's data to a basic screen display. Then, we can explore incorporating data from your Word/Excel files into a more visually appealing interface. Finally, we can refine the display based on customer feedback.

Would love to chat more about how to make this transition smooth and effective. Feel free to message me if you're free for a quick call.

proposals.job_title: Fractional Chief Learning and Content Officer for AI Training Platform

proposals.job_title: Software Design and Marketing Partners in US, Europe
proposals.description:
We are looking for partners from North America and Europe who would be interested in partnering with us for designing, developing and marketing AI platforms to automate workflows in Health Insurance, Property & Casualty Insurance. 
This would involve solving critical workflow problems of the companies in the above sectors. 
This would involve revenue sharing and equity . Post development you would be involved in business development for selling the platform among clients in the respective market...
proposals.message:
Hi there,

"Solving critical workflow problems" in insurance – that really resonates with me. I spent a chunk of last year untangling a particularly messy claims processing system for a small brokerage; the bottleneck was surprising, but it came down to a simple data entry issue, which, once automated, freed up their team immensely.

For your AI platform, I'd suggest first focusing on a deep dive into the *specific* workflows in health and P&C you want to address. Then, build a modular AI design so it can be adapted for different companies or products to gain quick access to markets. Finally, a detailed strategy for marketing the platform.

If you think this approach aligns with your vision, I'd be happy to chat more about the nitty-gritty.

proposals.job_title: API Integration + Dashboard Setup for Crypto Mining Data (ViaBTC)
proposals.description:
Description:
We operate a Bitcoin and altcoin mining business using ViaBTC as our primary pool. I’m looking for a skilled developer/data analyst to:

Objectives:
•	Set up API integration with ViaBTC (via API key or Watcher link)
•	Pull historical and real-time hashrate data by worker
•	Retrieve daily earnings data (account-level)
•	Estimate earnings per worker by proportional hashrate contribution
•	Build a dashboard (Google Sheets or Excel) to visualize:
o	Worker performance
o	Estimated earning...
proposals.message:
Hi there,

"Automation needs" definitely resonates with me. I remember early on in my career, spending days manually collating data from various sources - it's a soul-crushing task! That's what got me into automation in the first place.

For your ViaBTC data, I'd suggest starting by first establishing a robust API connection for both hashrate and earnings. Then, we can build out formulas in either Google Sheets or Excel (whichever you prefer) to distribute earnings proportionally across workers. Finally, we'll design a clear, visual dashboard that gives you the insights you need at a glance.

Would be great to chat further about your specific priorities and how to best approach this.

proposals.job_title: Experienced Qualcomm Rb5165 developer
proposals.description:
Hi there, 

I am COO at a UK based drone company. 

I am looking for an experienced developer for a short term contract to work on drone software architecture on embedded systems. This requires proficiency either C++\Qt and Linux, have a good understanding of Gstreamer and ideally experience with robotics based applications and protocols such as MAVLINK. It will primarily be working on the Qualcomm RB5165 platform and requires previous experience with integration and writing of drivers and other...
proposals.message:
Hi there,

"Drone software architecture on embedded systems... Qualcomm RB5165" – that sounds like a really interesting challenge. I've spent a good chunk of the last year knee-deep in similar projects. I was helping a client integrate some new camera tech on a custom robotics platform, and debugging the Gstreamer pipeline took longer than everything else *combined*. Learned a lot about optimizing those configurations the hard way!

For your drone project, I'd suggest we first really nail down the system architecture, especially how MAVLINK will integrate with the RB5165. Then, focus on the critical driver integration, prioritizing stability and performance. Finally, we can refine the Gstreamer pipeline for optimal video processing.

If this approach resonates, I'd be happy to hop on a quick call to discuss the project details and explore a plan of attack.

proposals.job_title: AI ingénieur
proposals.description:
ENGLISH BELOW//

Développeur Full-Stack - SaaS Prospection B2B (Mission longue)
Type: Contrat mensuel
Budget: $1,000 - $1,500 USD/mois
Durée: 6+ mois (évolutif)
Langue: Français requis

PROJET
Création d'un SaaS complet de prospection B2B automatisée avec IA.

STACK TECHNIQUE REQUIS
Backend :
Python (FastAPI ou Django)
PostgreSQL
APIs : OpenAI, LinkedIn, Gmail, Calendly
Queue system (Celery/Redis)
Frontend :
React.js ou Vue.js
Dashboard client complet
Interface d'administration
Automation :
n8n ...
proposals.message:
Bonjour!

Seeing you're focused on "automation needs" for your B2B SaaS, that really caught my eye. I spent a good chunk of last year wrestling with a similar challenge – integrating Calendly and Gmail automation into a marketing platform. Found that a robust queue system (we used Celery) was absolutely essential to avoid API overload.

For your project, I'd suggest we start by mapping out the key user journeys within the SaaS. Then, we can prototype the backend logic with FastAPI to ensure smooth API interactions with OpenAI and LinkedIn. Finally, we tackle the frontend with React.js, prioritizing a clear and intuitive dashboard.

Interested in chatting more about how we could bring this vision to life? I'm free for a quick call sometime next week.

proposals.job_title: Zoho Expert to Build Custom B2B Book Distribution Portal for Publishers & Retailers
proposals.description:
I am a book distributor managing a warehouse operation. I purchase printed books from publishers and sell them wholesale to bookstores and retailers.
I’m looking to build a custom B2B portal using the Zoho platform (Inventory, Commerce, Creator) to streamline this process with the following goals:
________________________________________
🎯 Project Objectives:
1.	Supplier Module (Publishers):
o	Register as “Suppliers”
o	Submit book metadata (ISBN, title, price, quantity)
o	Notify shipment arrival...
proposals.message:
Hey there,

Saw you're looking to streamline the book distribution process with Zoho, especially around managing publisher submissions and shipment notifications—totally get it! Managing inventory manually can be a real headache, and I've seen firsthand how it can bottleneck growth.

Once helped a small artisan cheese distributor implement a system where suppliers could directly update inventory levels via a portal. Cut their back-and-forth emails by about 70%.

For your project, I'd suggest first mapping out the exact data points needed from publishers. Then, we can build the Supplier module in Zoho Creator with Inventory integration, focusing on intuitive forms and automated notifications. Finally, link it all up with Zoho Commerce for the retail side.

Would love to chat for 15 minutes to hear more about the specifics. Let me know when might work.

client_intelligence.current_manual_process: Manual data collection and analysis for SEO and advertising campaigns, manual reporting, and inefficient client communication processes.

solution_architecture.core_solution: Implement AI-driven automation workflows using n8n to streamline data collection, analysis, and reporting. Integrate OpenAI for natural language processing to enhance client communication and automate routine inquiries.

solution_architecture.scalability_design: Design workflows with modular components to easily accommodate increased data volume and additional services as the agency grows.

implementation_roadmap.testing_approach: Conduct unit and integration testing to ensure data accuracy and workflow reliability

implementation_roadmap.success_metrics: Reduction in manual processing time, improved reporting accuracy, enhanced client satisfaction
